abstract: Charles E. Schumer, the Democratic senator from New York, and Richard Shelby, a Republican senator from Alabama, are expected to introduce new spending legislation on Thursday designed to beef up enforcement and detection of white-collar crime in the wake of the $50 billion fraud allegedly perpetrated by Bernard L. Madoff.

lead_paragraph: Charles E. Schumer, the Democratic senator from New York, and Richard C. Shelby, a Republican senator from Alabama, introduced new spending legislation on Thursday designed to increase enforcement and detection of white-collar crime in the wake of the $50 billion fraud allegedly perpetrated by Bernard L. Madoff.

headline.main: Senators Seek More Funds to Fight Financial Fraud
